pr_title: [KOGITO-1968] Allow milestones to trigger completion and tests

timeline.message:
[KOGITO-1968] Allow milestones to trigger completion and tests

Signed-off-by: ruromero <rromerom@redhat.com>

timeline.bodyText: why is this needed? if we make getAgenda() return null in the dummy implementation then you can just null check getAgenda(). Remember we want to get rid of the dummy implementation.
timeline.author: evacchi
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -45,6 +45,13 @@
      */
     Agenda getAgenda();
 
+    /**
+     * @return true if the Runtime supports the Agenda
+     */
+    default boolean hasAgenda() {

replies.bodyText: good point, +1
replies.author: tiagodolphine

timeline.bodyText: memo: I wonder if we should keep these overrides in Kogito
timeline.author: evacchi

timeline.bodyText: I can see now where rules are used, and we should probably write a short spec for this and see how we can reproduce it in the best way. Rule flow groups should be considered deprecated for Drools. Maybe we can write a "System RuleUnit" in the libary if these rules are static, or we could synthesize a rule unit to be used internally.
timeline.author: evacchi

replies.bodyText: I have filed the following JIRA https://issues.redhat.com/browse/KOGITO-2168
replies.author: ruromero

timeline.author: tiagodolphine
tiagodolphine

replies.bodyText: Although your suggestion is fancier I believe the existing code is easier to understand and maintain.
replies.author: ruromero

replies.bodyText: Sure, no problem, go with it, as I said just a suggestion a matter of taste, I really like and think a more functional approach is cleaner :)
replies.author: tiagodolphine

replies.bodyText: either way, this is just a refactoring of the existing code (@ruromero only added the null check around it and reformatted a bit); it doesn't really matter because I am pretty sure all this will have to be nuked in favor of rule units 🤔
replies.author: evacchi

timeline.bodyText: Are the castings safe? WorkflowProcess, WorkflowProcessInstance, Is it worth checking instanceof before casting?
timeline.author: tiagodolphine

replies.bodyText: If the legacyProcessInstance.getProcess() is always returning what is generated by the legacyProcess() method coming from the codegen I'd say the only possibility is that it is a RuleFlowProcess which extends WorkflowProcessImpl
replies.author: ruromero

timeline.bodyText: So Kogito process instance is completed, but legacy process instance is still active? Is that right? If so, why is it like that? I understand that cases are basically never complete as we discussed it on Zulip, but this can be considered as an inconsistency - one status is completed, the second one is active.
timeline.author: MarianMacik

replies.bodyText: Also btw - this feature is already present in 7.x? I think that we can there only close or destroy a case instance, right? We cannot explicitly complete it...
replies.author: MarianMacik

replies.bodyText:
Ad-hoc processes, i.e. cases, can't autocomplete unless there is a terminate end node but this is not common in cases where knowledge workers might want to add/update information in the case or trigger discretionary tasks. That means there wasn't a mechanism to close a case.
Regarding the naming. In 7.x you could close a case but here we are not explicitly using a Case model naming. We're still talking about processes and processes from the ACTIVE state move to the COMPLETED state, thus this action. Do you agree?
replies.author: ruromero

replies.bodyText: I agree, but somewhat I missed the explanation why the legacy process is still being kept ACTIVE :)
replies.author: MarianMacik

replies.bodyText: I get your point and that had to be aligned indeed. Thanks for your thorough review.
replies.author: ruromero

timeline.bodyText: from a perspective that processes will have at least some degree of structure, would it still make sense to allow it to be completed at any time? Thinking if we should first try to go for having a minial path that demonstrates how the process will be completed, not so much like a case close action. @ruromero @krisv wdyt?
timeline.author: cristianonicolai
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -65,7 +65,12 @@
      * @param referenceId optional reference id that points to a another  component triggering this instance
      */
     void startFrom(String nodeId, String referenceId);
-    
+
+    /**
+     * Completes a dynamic process that is in the ACTIVE state.
+     */
+    void complete();

replies.bodyText: I think this is something we need at this point and we can adapt later on. Dynamic processes need a way to be completed.
replies.author: ruromero

replies.bodyText: @ruromero sure, in the example you created the test can be completed once the milestone is achieved, we dont necessarly want to manually have to call complete in a process. We're trying to give some flexibility but not complete freedom, to me the process needs to to handle a expected path to end, otherwise people can still abort the process instance.
replies.author: cristianonicolai

replies.bodyText: Complete only affects dynamic processes that are active. How do you want to limit it's usage? By only allow processes without any active node to be completed for example?
replies.author: ruromero

timeline.bodyText: @ruromero is there any point for us to add this if we wont actually use this approach with the internal agenda? I guess we should simply set active to true.
timeline.author: cristianonicolai

replies.bodyText: I didn't want to remove the old functionality because other tests still rely on the agenda. Until we don't provide a replacement for conditions I prefer to keep it this way.
replies.author: ruromero

replies.bodyText: so maybe we should remove the old tests as well :) My concern is to bring things that we wont/dont need, removing later is way more complicated to assess.
replies.author: cristianonicolai

replies.bodyText: I'm always up for removing stuff. I just didn't dare to do it without a second opinion.
replies.author: ruromero

replies.bodyText: sorry, wrong gitlog :P looks fine as is
replies.author: cristianonicolai

timeline.bodyText: @ruromero should the actual milestone state be checked here?
timeline.author: cristianonicolai

replies.bodyText: Check my latest changes
replies.author: ruromero

timeline.author: cristianonicolai

replies.bodyText: Not exactly this but I see your point
replies.author: ruromero

timeline.author: cristianonicolai

replies.bodyText: I want to make sure the state in the processInstance and in the legacyProcessInstance are in sync
replies.author: ruromero

timeline.bodyText: Im not sure what's the point in regards to testing milestones to call complete here, I would recommend removing it.
timeline.author: cristianonicolai

replies.bodyText: As discussed I have removed the complete method. A terminate end node must be present in order for the dynamic process to complete
replies.author: ruromero

timeline.bodyText: @ruromero I guess the idea would be to add a method into RuleFlowProcessInstance with a list of miliestones, that then we could check using a status like MilestoneStatus from v7. No need to publish it in the ProcessInstance object for now.
timeline.author: cristianonicolai

replies.bodyText: I have added the milestones method as suggested
replies.author: ruromero
